description: Students explore the historical development of musical concepts, styles, and repertoires in India, the Middle East, Indonesia, and China from the earliest recorded times to the present. While addressing the distinctive philosophical foundations of music-making in these areas and the impact of cultural encounters and changing systems of government, patronage, and mediation, students will gain a deeper understanding of the relationship between music, history, and culture. Prerequisites: MUSIC 241 and MUSIC 242.
name: Top: Asian Music Historical Persp

revisions.desc: Students encounter in-depth studies in a specific topic or area of music history. The content and nature of this course are determined by the instructor and the music department. Sample topics include American music, studies in classical music, opera, and folk and pop influences in art music. May be repeated if topic is different. Offered each semester. Prerequisites: MUSIC 241 and MUSIC 242.

title: Advanced Study in Music History
